page.title: 04EYKE PARISHONER'S ATTITUDES
page.content: People living here seem generally concerned with rural matters and the preservation of the countryside, either because they are involved with farming or because they choose to live in this rather isolated area. The nearby U.S.A.F. Bases of Bentwaters and Woodbridge, however, make a direct impact upon the people in contradictory ways. There is some resentment concerning the high noise level of aircraft, and the increased volume of traffic on the road, as well as the pressure on housing. Even in this isolated area with a total of 26 dwellings, 4 American Service personnel live. On the other hand, people are generally pleased about the employment generated by the presence of the Base (some English people living in this area work on the Base).
